name: CreateOrUpdateGithubRepoSecret
description:
Create or update a GitHub repository secret with an encrypted value.

Use this tool to create or update a secret in a GitHub repository by providing an encrypted value. Requires authentication with a token having the `repo` scope or GitHub App permissions. Useful for managing sensitive information in repositories.

parameters.name: repository_owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repository_name
parameters.description: The name of the GitHub repository. It is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: secret_name
parameters.description: The name of the secret to create or update in the repository.

parameters.name: encrypted_secret_value
parameters.description: The secret's value encrypted with LibSodium using a repository's public key.

value_schema.description: Value for your secret, encrypted with [LibSodium](https://libsodium.gitbook.io/doc/bindings_for_other_languages) using the public key retrieved from the [Get a repository public key](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server@3.8/rest/reference/actions#get-a-repository-public-key) endpoint.

parameters.name: encryption_key_id
parameters.description: Provide the ID of the key used to encrypt the secret.

value_schema.description: ID of the key you used to encrypt the secret.
